enrolledCoursesData.title: Basics of Networking and HTML Beginner to Advanced Course
enrolledCoursesData.description: Learn web development fundamentals, covering frontend, backend, and database structures. Explore client-server dynamics, APIs, various IP types, DNS workings, and HTML essentials with an introduction to CSS for crafting interactive websites

content.title: Course Introduction
content.description: Welcome to the course! In this introductory module, you'll get a glimpse of what's in store. We'll outline the course structure, set expectations, and highlight the outcomes you can anticipate upon completion.

content.title: Expectations & Outcomes
content.description: Understand the goals of this course and what you'll gain by the end. We'll discuss the skills you'll acquire, the knowledge you'll gain, and how it will benefit you in the realm of web development and networking.

content.title: Web Development & Scopes
content.description: Explore the vast landscape of web development careers. Learn about the diverse scopes and job opportunities available in the industry, providing you with insights to shape your career path.

content.title: Frontend Backend Architecture
content.description: Delve into the intricacies of frontend and backend architecture. Understand how these components work together to create seamless and responsive web applications, laying the foundation for your development journey.

content.title: Database
content.description: Uncover the importance of databases in web development. Learn what are the types of database available and the free cloud services providing free database for developers.

content.title: IP & Types
content.description: Navigate the world of Internet Protocol (IP) addresses. Gain a comprehensive understanding of IP types and their significance in the networking landscape.

content.title: IPv4 vs IPv6
content.description: Compare IPv4 and IPv6, the two versions of the Internet Protocol. Understand the differences and advancements that IPv6 brings to address the limitations of IPv4.

content.title: Static vs Dynamic IP
content.description: Explore the distinction between static and dynamic IP addresses. Learn how each type is assigned and its impact on network configurations.

questions.question: What does "frontend" refer to in web development?
options: The part of a website users interact with
The server-side logic of a website
questions.selected: The part of a website users interact with

questions.question: What is the primary role of "backend" in web development?
What does "IP" stand for in networking?
What is the total range of each octet in an IPv4 address?

content.title: DNS
content.description: Dive into the Domain Name System (DNS) and unravel the process of translating domain names to IP addresses. Explore the role DNS plays in making web browsing seamless.

content.title: What is API?
content.description: Application Programming Interfaces (APIs). Understand their significance in web development, facilitating communication between different software systems.

content.title: What is HTML
content.description: Begin your journey into the core of web development with HTML. Learn the basics of structuring web content and creating the foundation for interactive websites.

content.title: HTML Page Structure
content.description: Master the art of organizing your web pages. Explore HTML tags that define the structure of a webpage, providing a solid foundation for your coding endeavors.

questions.question: What is the primary function of DNS in web development?
options: To translate domain names to IP addresses
questions.selected: To translate domain names to IP addresses

questions.question: What does 'API' stand for in web development?
What is the main markup language used for creating web pages??
What does 'HTML' stand for?

content.title: Text tags
content.description: Explore the world of text manipulation in HTML. Discover tags that enhance the presentation of textual content on your web pages.

content.title: List tags
content.description: Explore HTML's list tags to efficiently structure information. Learn how to create ordered and unordered lists for better content organization.

content.title: Anchor tag
content.description: Unlock the power of hyperlinking with the anchor tag. Understand how to connect different pages and resources within your website.

content.title: Image tag
content.description: Bring visual appeal to your web pages with the image tag. Learn how to integrate images seamlessly into your HTML content.

content.title: Audio & video tag
content.description: Elevate user engagement with multimedia elements. Explore the audio and video tags to incorporate media seamlessly into your web projects.

content.title: iframe & embed tag
content.description: Harness the capabilities of iframe and embed tags. Understand how these tags enable the integration of external content within your web pages.

content.title: Div tag
content.description: Master the versatile div tag. Learn how it acts as a container, allowing you to structure and style your HTML content effectively.

content.title: Input tags
content.description: Dive into user interaction with HTML input tags. Explore various input types and understand how they enable user data input.

content.title: Button tag
content.description: Elevate user experience with interactive buttons. Learn the ins and outs of the button tag and its various applications.

content.title: Form part 1
content.description: Embark on the journey of web forms. In part one, explore the essential elements that make up a form, setting the stage for user data collection.

content.title: Form part 2
content.description: Delve deeper into the world of web forms. In part two, learn about form validation, submission methods, and enhance the functionality of your forms.

content.title: Table tag
content.description: Uncover the power of HTML tables. Learn how to structure and display data in a tabular format for improved readability.

content.title: Semantic HTML - 1
content.description: Embrace semantic HTML for enhanced accessibility and SEO. In part one, understand how semantic tags contribute to the meaning and structure of your content.

content.title: Semantic HTML - 2
content.description: Continue your journey into semantic HTML. In part two, explore additional tags that enrich the semantics of your web pages.

content.title: Web Crawler
content.description: Understand how websites are ranked to top by web crawling. Understand the fundamentals of how search engines navigate and index content across the vast web.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Text tags' in HTML?
Which HTML tags are used for creating ordered and unordered lists?
What does the 'Anchor tag' (<a>) primarily facilitate in HTML?
What does the term 'Web Crawler' refer to in the context of HTML?
options: A program for navigating and indexing web content
questions.selected: A program for navigating and indexing web content

content.title: More HTML tags
content.description: Expand your HTML toolkit with additional tags. Discover tags that cater to specific needs, enhancing the richness of your web pages.

content.title: Project 1 - 1
content.description: Apply your newfound HTML skills in a practical project. In part one, embark on a hands-on project to where we build a small FAQ page by using semantic HTML tags and using font awesome icons.

content.title: Project 1 - 2
content.description: Continue your project journey in part two. Apply advanced HTML concepts and solidify your skills through a comprehensive project that showcases your abilities.

content.title: Project 2
content.description: Level up with an in-depth project. Demonstrate your proficiency in HTML as you undertake a larger-scale project, integrating various elements learned throughout the course.

content.title: Web Hosting
content.description: Unravel the mysteries of web hosting. Learn how to take your web projects live by exploring different hosting options and understanding the basics of site configurations.

content.title: CSS
content.description: Transition seamlessly from HTML to CSS. In this module, delve into the world of Cascading Style Sheets to add style and visual appeal to your web pages.

questions.question: In 'Project 1 - 1', what HTML semantic tags were primarily used for creating a FAQ page?
In 'Project 1 - 2', how did you make an image float using HTML?
options: Inserted a 'float' tag around the image

questions.question: What was the focus of 'Project 2' in your HTML course?
What is web hosting in the context of web development?
options: A service that allows individuals and organizations to make their websites accessible via the World Wide Web
A method of creating dynamic web pages
A technique for optimizing website performance
A module covered in the CSS section
questions.selected: A service that allows individuals and organizations to make their websites accessible via the World Wide Web

content.title: Wrap up
content.description: Congratulations on completing the course! In this final module, recap your journey, reflect on your accomplishments, and gain insights into the next steps in your web development adventure.

requirements: Text editor for writing HTML code
Web Browser to view the output of HTML code
enrolledCoursesData.author: N.U.Thejas hari
enrolledCoursesData.name: logesh rav
